titles.title: Criminal Alien Departure Act of 1987
A bill to establish a demonstration program in New York City to offer voluntary departure from the United States to certain aliens arrested for narcotics-related offenses.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Criminal Alien Departure Act of 1987 - Directs the Attorney General to develop a 12-month demonstration program to offer voluntary departure from the United States to any deportable alien arrested in New York City for certain narcotics related offenses. Requires the Attorney General to report to the Congress on the results of such program. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1988.
